Clubs & Activities List

Adventure Club

Ms. Deutch, O260 and Ms. Vanguilder, C126
(m_deutsch@saratogaschools.org)
(a_vanguilder@saratogaschools.org)

A fun and exciting way to explore the history of our area and go on adventures near and far (mostly near) to learn about all kinds of cool things our region has to offer!

A Hand Up Club

Ms. Oswald, F188 and Ms. Ogden, S278
(j_oswald@saratogaschools.org)
(d_ogden@saratogaschools.org)

Character education through volunteering and community service.

Animal Social Club

TBD

Education on responsible pet ownership and pet care with activities to benefit needy animals in the area.

Artists Who Care

TBD

send positive messages through art displays, work with charities, & bring the enjoyment of art to others in the community.

Best Buddies

Ms. DOUGLAS, D168, Ms. Oswald, F188 & Ms. Boucher,  D164
(b_douglas@saratogaschools.org)

Provides opportunities for one-to-one friendships between people with social and intellectual challenges and people who are kind and generous.

Canteen Club

Ms. Moore, P230
(a_moore@saratogaschools.org)

Supports student council through social events, fundraisers for worthy causes, and creating school spirit.

Chess/Game Board Club

Mr. Baldwin, C131

m_baldwin@saratogaschools.org

Chess players of all levels are welcome. if you’d like to play competitively or just learn the game, come to Colombian room 131. Other games of choice may be played too if desired.


Fiddle Club

Ms. Drellos, B108
(c_drellos@saratogaschools.org)

Open to 7th & 8th graders interested in the style of fiddle music. No audition required. Regular attendance is encouraged as we will be learning new songs by ear during each meeting.

French Club

Ms. Decker, E142
(s_decker@saratogaschools.org)

To instill an understanding of and appreciation for French speaking countries.

International Club

Ms. Carusone, S277, Ms. Clifton, S275 & Ms. Canjura
(n_carusone@saratogaschools.org)
(k_clifton@saratogaschools.org)
(k_canjura@saratogaschools.org)

An exciting opportunity for all students to explore various world cultures and their relevance in our daily lives and share their experiences with the rest of the school and community.

Introduction to Bagpiping

Ms. Barber, P222
(s_barber@saratogaschools.org)

Explore the history & sounds of bagpiping. In small groups, start learning the basics of playing the practice chanter.

Jazz Combo Club

Mr. Doyle, C122
(j_doyle@saratogaschools.org)

Exposure to various jazz styles, explore improvisation techniques, & participate in performances throughout the district.

Knitting Club

Ms. Levin, A119
(h_levin@saratogaschools.org)

For students who are at all levels of knitting ability.

MAGSA (Maple Ave. Gay-Straight Alliance) Club

Allen Kane
a_kane@saratogaschools.org

A support and social group. Our goal is to provide a comfortable space that teaches tolerance and resilience, as well as keeping an open mind. We also aim to provide a place to make friends, find support and be proud of who you are!

Maple Avenue Chamber Orchestra

Ms. Drellos, B108
(c_drellos@saratogaschools.org)

Offers 7th & 8th graders an opportunity to play in a more advanced string orchestra with smaller sections. Open by auditions. 6th graders are welcome to try out but 7th & 8th graders will be accepted first.

Mapletogian Newspaper Club

Ms. Phillips, R239
(t_phillips@saratogaschools.org)

Come help with the design and creation of the school newspaper.

Math Club

Jenelle Miles, R232

j_miles@saratogaschools.org

Helps to build confidence in students of all abilities and interest levels by giving them the opportunity to engage in unique math activities in a relaxed, social setting. 

Musical

Ms. Calvin
(c_calvin@saratogaschools.org)

Annual production offering acting, singing, dancing & social experiences culminating in a full length musical stage performance.

Orchestra Performance Club

Ms. Drellos, B108
(c_drellos@saratogaschools.org)

Open to students in the string program who are interested in participating in extra performance opportunities. Events will sometimes require a permission slip, recommendation or audition to participate.

PBIS Student Activities Club

Ms. Ellis, C127 & Ms. Hubbs O263
(e_ellis@saratogaschools.org)
(a_hubbs@saratogaschools.org)

Finds creative ways & projects to inspire students to be good citizens.

Peer Mentoring Club

Ms. Minehan, A118
(j_minehan@saratogaschools.org)

Is a group of 8th grade students selected in 7th year to train and become peer mentors to a nominated group of 6th grade students supporting them for the entire school year as they meet the challenges of middle school.

Rock Lab/Guitar Club

Mr. Todd, O241 

(d_todd@saratogaschools.org)

An after school club for all 6-8 grade students. although is says guitar in name, it’s open to any instruments and vocals..  you will need a ride to and from school with your instrument.  some experience will be beneficial.

Science Fair Club

Mr. Scrivo, O267
(j_scrivo@saratogaschools.org)

Conduct fun scientific experiments, observe spectacular science demonstrations, play science trivia, and much, much, much more!

Ski Club

Melissa Deutsch, O260 and Mr. Scrivo, O267
(m_deutsch@saratogaschools.org)
(j_scrivo@saratogaschools.org)

Exercise, socialization, & fun while learning to ski. Ski trips are during January & February.

Student Council

Kevin Himmelwright, F184 & Wendi Kerls, D178 

(k_himmelwright@saratogaschools.org)

(w_kerls@saratogaschools.org)

Promote school spirit, address student concerns, lead activities to benefit charitable organizations, & help out the school community.

TV Studio Clubs

Ms. Chabot, D175 , Ms. Hubbs, O263 & Mr. Todd O241
(a_hubbs@saratogaschools.org)
(j_chabot@saratogaschools.org)
(d_todd@saratogaschools.org)

Students will learn first hand how to operate the Maple Avenue T.V. studio, and aspects of production including graphics generation, audio and video production for on air performance of student morning announcements. 

Voice Clubs 6,7,8

Ms. Levin, C122 & Ms. Jackson O249
(H_Levin@saratogaschools.org)

(c_jackson@saratogaschools.org)

Musical experiences for solo & group singers preparing for the NYSSMA solo festival or all-county chorus.

WDC Club

Ms. Moore, R230 and Ms. Phillips, R239
(a_moore@saratogaschools.org)
(t_phillips@saratogaschools.org)

For 8th grade students to help contribute to planning the 8th grade trip to Washington D.C. Fundraising and learning ins and outs of planning events.

Yearbook Club

Ms. D’angelo, B105 & Ms. Minehan, A118
(c_dangelo@saratogaschools.org)
(j_minehan@saratogaschools.org)

Take photos of events & candid moments of school happenings. Help organize, produce, & distribute the school’s yearbook.
